scenario_text.value:
This is bad, Takuma... Aoi still hasn’t come
back.
(Minoru is obviously upset...)

(And not just him, but Kaito and Miu, too...
Not to mention me.)

(No one’s seen her since the battle
yesterday.)

(We were able to avoid the oncoming fog and
make it back here.)

(We hoped she’d be back by the time we were,
but that didn’t pan out.)
Where could Aoi have gone?

Dammit! If I’d noticed what was going on
I could’ve stopped her!
How could I let her slip away like that?

It’s not your fault, Kaito. I didn’t notice
either.

I knew she was really struggling with Saki’s
death, but I still...
I still let her out of my sight.

At least we can rest assured that Labramon
went after her.

(True. As soon as we noticed she was gone,
Labramon went flying out of the library.)
(And they haven’t been back since then.)
I’m sure Labramon is already by Aoi’s side now.

Yeah! If anyone can find her, Labramon should
be able to!
Yeah... For sure.

But...you never know. What if enemies found
her first?

No way! Labramon wouldn’t let anything
happen!

You don’t know that. What if she...ended up
like Saki?
Don’t cry, Miu...
I’m so tired of this!

I don’t wanna see anyone else get hurt or
die!

Come on, we still don’t know what happened to
Aoi!
I know...

(I believe Aoi’s safe. But I also understand
how anxious Miu feels.)
I’m sorry. It’s my fault that she’s gone.
Renamon... We don’t intend to blame you.

We know you did what you did because you
wanted to help Miyuki.

Yeah. Once we start pointing fingers,
there’ll be no end to it.
The Master’s really the one to blame.

By the way, Renamon, why did you go back to
looking like Haru?

I was wondering the same thing. Isn’t it
distressful to stay in that form...?

I know I said it’s humiliating to imitate you
like this...

But that was the old me talking. I don’t feel
strange in this form anymore.

It actually feels more natural than my
original one.
Miyuki responds better to this form, too.
Renamon...

We never know when she’ll appear again, so
it’s best for me to be in this form.

It’ll make it easier for her to regain
control of her mind.
That makes sense, I suppose.

But back to the matter at hand—what should we
do?

We could look for Aoi or forge ahead... But
we hardly have time for both.
What do you mean by “forge ahead”?

Making escape with those left is our top
priority. We need to rescue Miyuki for that.

I hate to say it, but maybe we should give up
on Aoi to make that happen...

So we should just save ourselves, and no one
else matters? You gotta be kidding, man!

Calm down, Kaito! I... I don’t think what the
professor’s saying is wrong.
Miu! Don’t tell me you’d abandon Aoi, too?
No! I wanna believe she’s alive somewhere.

But it’s morning now and she’s nowhere to be
seen. Between the fog and enemies...

Can you really say for sure she’s safe out
there somewhere? That she’s still alive?
Not for sure...but still!
Looking for her is just asking for trouble!

I said it before and I’ll say it again...
I don’t want to lose anyone else!

(Miu has a point. We should probably keep
going before we lose someone else.)

I’m in no place to say this considering what
I did to her, but...

I understand how much you don’t want to give
up, and how deep your bonds are.

I’d say we can spare the time to try and
track her down.
Are you sure you don’t mind, Renamon?
What do you mean by that?

It’s just... I know how badly you want to
save Miyuki.
I was thinking the same thing.

I do want to save Miyuki as soon as possible.
However...

The Master won’t let us have her back without
a tough fight.

I didn’t want to admit it at first, but...
I need all of your help to make this happen.

So I just thought... Finding Aoi would be
good from this perspective, too.
Renamon!

(Renamon’s right, though. There’s only five
of us and our partners left.)

(We’ll need everyone’s help to save Miyuki,
not to mention the whole world!)

I say we listen to Renamon and go find Aoi.
It’s not time to give up!
Now that’s the Takuma I know!
I agree with Takuma, too.

I don’t want to lose anyone else. So that
means we gotta act.
I’m sorry for acting like this, Kaito...
It’s fine, Miu. It’s only natural to be scared.

That’s right! But there’s nothing to
fear, Miu. I’ll protect you.
Okay... I’ll try not to cry anymore.

All right then, let’s get moving! Time to
track down Aoi and Labramon!
But...how?
Er...

Maybe we should start with the area around
the school, and places without fog?

Labramon will definitely try to get her to
come back to the school.

If they’ve come back here we should be able
to find some trace of them.
Good point! That’s my Falcomon!
If it’s settled then, let’s get cracking.

The longer we wait, the more the fog will
spread. Let’s hurry before it’s too late.

Yeah! Let’s split up and search for <color=#B41919>Aoi</color> and
<color=#B41919>Labramon</color>!
